name: Vyper Industries
slogan: Ecommerce agency specialised on Amazon, eBay and Shopify
description:
Vyper has grown over the last 7 years to become a highly respected Ecommerce Agency, recognised by clients globally for our expertise and capability on the Amazon, eBay and Shopify platforms in an advisory, operational and marketing capacity.

With offices in 3 key territories (UK [HQ], Japan and Germany), Vyper has established itself as a global partner for brands large and small whom want to establish and maximise their digital sales channels as well as reach in the EMEA, APAC and North American regions. 

Our team is characterised as a young, dynamic group who seek to deliver creative and innovative solutions to the clients. Willingness to take on responsibility, entrepreneurial spirit and problem-solving capabilities are highly valued attributes that embody the Vyper ethos.

jobs.title: Account Manager
jobs.description:
About the Role
We're looking for a qualified Account Manager to join our team in London and grow our global client base through development of various e-commerce channels. 

The role covers the following key responsibilities:

•	Consulting, managing and servicing multiple clients as well as working to agree priorities and deliverables.
•	Develop and grow strategic relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
•	Actively manage client accounts through different platforms, ensuring sales targets are met and brand strategy is correctly implemented.
•	Work with the internal operations team to assign tasks designed to support your activities.
•	Troubleshoot where necessary in order to ensure the smooth running of your clients. 
•	Analyse e-commerce data and make suggestions and decisions relating to the needs of your clients to influence their online retail strategy.
•	Deliver weekly and monthly e-commerce platform insights, reports and analysis to your portfolio of clients.
•	Onboarding new clients to ensure their account is properly setup to be managed.
•	Occasional travel to meet face to face with your clients. 
•	Work collaboratively with internal and external teams to achieve account goals and targets.


What we are looking for:
•	Excellent natural communicator. 
•	2+ years of professional experience in account management. 
•	Strong Microsoft Excel skills, ability to work with large data sets).
•	Sound business acumen – can build strategies and concepts to fit a client’s needs.
•	E-commerce experience required, preferably with Amazon and, eBay, Shopify.
•	Self-starter and self-motivated individual, with an entrepreneurial mindset that can be used to creatively drive growth on their accounts.
•	Being able to work in a small unstructured and entrepreneurial business environment.
•	Highly organised and able to multitask without any loss of output or focus.

What we offer    
 
We offer our employees a great package of perks, including:
•	21 days of holiday per year (excl bank holidays).
•	Free day off on your birthday.
•	Great learning and development opportunities at an international level in a startup environment.
•	Unrivalled exposure and insight into the world of e-commerce, end to end. 
•	Highly entrepreneurial working environment.
•	Discretionary performance related bonus.
•	Funding for professional development courses.
•	Wear your own clothes, casual dress code – burn your suit. 
•	Free products and exclusive discounts. 
•	Free office snacks and breakfast – fill your boots.

jobs.title: GoPro E-commerce Account Manager
jobs.description:
About the Role
We are looking for an experienced Account Manager to join our growing team in London to own the exciting and fast paced relationship with GoPro, one of our primary accounts. This role will be focussed on managing GoPro’s eBay and Amazon businesses currently located in the regions Asia Pacific (Japan, Australia, China and Singapore) and Europe (UK, France, Germany, Italy & Spain). 

The role covers the following key responsibilities:

•	Consulting, managing and servicing GoPro, fielding and actioning a number of their daily requests.
•	Working directly between GoPro and Amazon/eBay to agree priorities and deliverables.
•	Being resourceful and entrepreneurial in order to leverage the GoPro brand and drive sales across all platforms under management. 
•	Develop and grow strategic relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
•	Actively manage multiple aspects of the GoPro e-commerce business throughout the different platforms, ensuring sales targets are met and brand strategy is correctly implemented.
•	Work with the internal operations team to assign tasks designed to support your activities.
•	Co-ordinate with our Japan based team daily to ensure requests and strategies are implemented at a local level. 
•	Troubleshoot and resolve tasks to ensure the smooth running of your accounts. 
•	Analyse e-commerce data, make suggestions and decisions relating to the needs of your clients to influence their Amazon and eBay strategies.
•	Deliver weekly and monthly e-commerce platform insights, reports and analysis to your key contacts.
•	Explore new opportunities to grow and develop the business in new and existing markets, including deploying the brand on new Amazon platforms as they launch.
•	Occasional travel to meet face to face with your clients, including the chance to travel to Asia.  

What we are looking for:
•	Excellent verbal and written communication. A real communicator, especially over the phone. 
•	3+ years of professional experience in account management. 
•	Strong Microsoft Excel skills, ability to work with large data sets.
•	Sound business acumen – can build strategies and concepts to fit a client’s needs.
•	Ability to think commercially in order to monetise opportunities for both Vyper and GoPro. 
•	E-commerce experience required, preferably working with Amazon and eBay. 
•	Knowledge of Amazon Vendor and Seller Centrals.
•	Self-starter and self-motivated individual, with an entrepreneurial mindset that can be used to creatively drive growth on their accounts.
•	Being able to work in a small and fast paced entrepreneurial start-up environment.
•	Highly organised and able to multitask without any loss of output or focus.
•	Eager and able to learn new systems and processes quickly. 
What we offer    
We offer our employees a great package of perks, including:
•	21 days of holiday per year (excl bank holidays).
•	Free day off on your birthday.
•	Great learning and development opportunities at an international level in a start-up working environment.
•	Free products (including GoPro’s!) and exclusive discounts. 
•	Funding for professional development courses.
•	Wear your own clothes, casual dress code – burn your suit.
•	Free office snacks and daily breakfast provision – fill your boots.
•	Unrivalled exposure and insight into the world of e-commerce especially on Amazon and eBay. 
•	Highly entrepreneurial working environment.
•	International exposure working with a global Brand.
•	Performance related bonus.
